Description: THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT RECLAMATION AND THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLABORATE TO RECRUIT AND PLACE YOUTH INTERNS AT RECLAMATION FACILITIES AND OFFICES WHERE THE INTERN CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION S ROLES IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES.

THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT WILL COST SHARE THE RECRUITMENT ANDPLACEMENT OF YOUTH INTERNS AT RECLAMATION FACILITIES AND OFFICES SO THEY CAN GAIN A BETTERUNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATIONS ROLE IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES.YOUTH INTERNS ARE COLLEGE AGE VOLUNTEERS, INCLUDING CURRENT OR RECENT GRADUATES, ALL OF WHOM WILL BE QUALIFIED PERSONS OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER, WHO VOLUNTEER THEIR SERVICES THROUGH THE RECIPIENT IN EXCHANGE FOR TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE WHICH FURTHERS THEIR EDUCATIONAL CAREER OR PERSONAL GOALS.  ALL INDIVIDUALLY PLACED INTERNS ARE UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF RECLAMATION.

RECLAMATION IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH SO THEY CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATIONS ROLE IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES. ADDITIONALLY, RECLAMATION WANTS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO BE INVOLVED IN CONSERVING RECLAMATIONS NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES SUCH AS THESE PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THESE YOUTH TO DEVELOP PROFESSIONAL AND LIFE SKILLS AS WELL AS AN INCREASED AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ETHICS AND STEWARDSHIP.THE INFORMATION GATHERED FOR THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY DETERMINING MANAGEMENT PLANNING FOR THE AREA AT LARGE FOR RECREATIONAL USE FOR THE PUBLIC.THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT SHALL COLLABORATE TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE PROJECTS DESCRIBED BELOW WHICH WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH. RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT WILL COST SHARE THE RECRUITMENT AND PLACEMENT OF (1) QUALIFIED YOUTH INTERN FOR THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATIONS DURANGO FIELD OFFICE, AND (3) QUALIFIED YOUTH INTERNS FOR THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATIONS GRAND JUNCTION FIELD OFFICE. THE YOUTH INTERNS SHALL BE UNDER THE OVERSIGHT OF RECLAMATION.PROJECT DESCRIPTION RECIPIENT, IN COOPERATION WITH RECLAMATION, SHALL RECRUIT THREE (4) QUALIFIED PEOPLE, 18 YEARS OR OLDER, THAT HAVE COMPLETED AT LEAST ONE YEAR AT AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION. THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES NECESSARY FOR THESE POSITIONS INCLUDE:THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES NECESSARY FOR THE 3 NATURAL RESOURCE AND RECREATION POSITIONS INCLUDE:KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, RECREATION, NATURAL AND CULTURAL HISTORY, NATIVE FISH AND WILDLIFE, AND GENERAL OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE  ANDKNOWLEDGE OF CONSERVATION EDUCATION PRACTICES  ACTIVITIES AND ASSOCIATED.THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES NECESSARY FOR THE CULTURAL INTERN POSITION INCLUDE:ABILITY TO ENGAGE IN CULTURAL RESOURCE FIELD SURVEY AND DOCUMENTATION ABILITY TO MAKE PRESENTATIONS TO COLLEAGUES, MANAGEMENT, AND EXTERNAL STAKEHOLDERS  AND DEVELOPMENT OF OFFICIAL CORRESPONDENCETHE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES NECESSARY FOR ALL NATURAL RESOURCE, RECREATION AND CULTURAL INTERN POSITIONS INCLUDE:ABILITY TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHERS TO EXPRESS IDEAS CLEARLY AND CONCISELY, BOTH ORALLY AND IN WRITING  TO EXERCISE INITIATIVE AND WORK INDEPENDENTLY  AND TO TAKE DIRECTION AND INSTRUCTION.ABILITIES THAT ARE HIGHLY DESIRABLE, BUT NOT REQUIRED, FOR THE INTERN POSITIONS THAT WILL COLLECT DATA INCLUDE GIS GPS KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT RECLAMATION AND THE RECPIENT WILL COLLABORATE TO RECRUIT AND PLACE YOUTH INTERNS AT RECLAMATION FACILITES AND OFFICES WHERE THE INTERN CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION S ROLES IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES.

RECLAMATION FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE INTERNSHIP PARTICIPANTS WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND PROPERTY MANAGEMENT DIVISION (FAPMD). PARTICIPANTS WILL WORK WITH GRANT MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL CONSIDERED TO BE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS (SMES). INTERNS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE APPROPRIATE FUNCTIONAL AREA FOR PROJECT MANAGER AND MENTOR ASSIGNMENT ALIGNED WITH THEIR EDUCATION AND CAREER AREAS OF INTEREST. INTERNS WILL WORK ON PROJECT DELIVERABLES THAT DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO RECLAMATION S FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MISSION ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS.RECLAMATION   FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE INTERNSHIP PARTICIPANTS WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE   FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND PROPERTY MANAGEMENT DIVISION (FAPMD). PARTICIPANTS   WILL WORK WITH GRANT MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL CONSIDERED TO BE SUBJECT MATTER   EXPERTS (SMES). INTERNS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE APPROPRIATE FUNCTIONAL AREA   FOR PROJECT MANAGER AND MENTOR ASSIGNMENT ALIGNED WITH THEIR EDUCATION AND   CAREER AREAS OF INTEREST. INTERNS WILL WORK ON PROJECT DELIVERABLES THAT   DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO RECLAMATION S FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MISSION ESSENTIAL   FUNCTIONS.

1. AWARD PURPOSE:RECLAMATION IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH SO THEY CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION'S ROLE IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES. ADDITIONALLY, RECLAMATION WANTS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO BE INVOLVED IN CONSERVING RECLAMATION'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES SUCH AS THESE PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THESE YOUTH TO DEVELOP PROFESSIONAL AND LIFE SKILLS AS WELL AS AN INCREASED AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ETHICS AND STEWARDSHIP. RECLAMATION YOUTH INTERNS (YOUTH INTERNS) WILL GAIN ON-THE-JOB EXPERIENCE IN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT THROUGH PLACEMENTS LASTING FROM TWO WEEKS TO ONE YEAR. YOUTH INTERNS WILL ENGAGE IN PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS SOME OF THE MOST CRITICAL CONSERVATION ISSUES ON RECLAMATION LAND, INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION, SPECIES PRESERVATION, FUELS TREATMENTS, RESEARCH AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS BUSINESS, ADMINISTRATIVE, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL SUPPORT TO PROGRAM/SPECIALIST CAPACITIES, AND SPECIES PRESERVATION.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE INTERNS WORKING IN A TEAM ENVIRONMENT AS A TEAM LEADER, WILL COORDINATE COMMUNICATION WITH INTERNAL GRANT MANAGEMENT SPECIALIST STAFF, EXTERNAL POLICY MAKERS ALONG WITH THE AO AND AGREEMENT RECIPIENTS WE SERVE. INTERNS WILL MANAGE THE DOCUMENTATION OF THE OVERALL PROCESS, RESOLVE CONFLICTS, WHETHER INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL AS THEY ARISE AND DEVELOP BUY-IN WITH ALL STAKEHOLDERS INVOLVED. INTERNS WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE IN MANAGING A TEAM, CONFLICT RESOLUTION, PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND INSIGHT INTO THE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FIELD.3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:5.1.1 PROJECT A: NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY STEP-BY-STEP SOP & LOGIC FLOW CHART5.1.2 PROJECT B: PRE-AWARD PROCESS STEP-BY-STEP SOP & LOGIC FLOW CHART5.1.3 PROJECT C: POST AWARD PROCESS STEP-BY-STEP SOP & LOGIC FLOW CHART4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES):INTERN AND GENERAL PUBLIC
GIS INTERNSHIP

1. AWARD PURPOSE:THE ABILITY TO PROVIDE FIRE PROTECTION TO THE COMMUNITIES LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE URBAN INTERFACE WITH THE WILDERNESS AS PER THE GENERAL PLAN/RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PLAN 2021. THE PURPOSE OF THE SHADED FUEL BREAK PROJECT ON RECLAMATION LANDS IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN A FIRE-ADAPTED ECOSYSTEM BY THINNING DENSE VEGETATION AND REMOVING DEAD AND DYING FUELS THAT CAN SUPPORT INTENSE FIRE BEHAVIOR WITH PRESCRIBED SHADED FUEL BREAK TREATMENTS. A SHADED FUEL BREAK CAN GREATLY REDUCE THE INTENSITY OF A WILDLAND FIRE, PREVENT FIRES FROM REACHING TREE CANOPIES, AND PROVIDE THE FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND OTHER RESPONDING AGENCIES WITH A DEFENSIBLE POINT TO FIGHT WILDLAND FIRES AND PROTECT HOMES AND INFRASTRUCTURE. BY REDUCING THE WILDFIRE INTENSITY FACTOR, THE POTENTIAL FOR ECOSYSTEM/HABITAT DESTRUCTION AND IMPACTS TO WATER QUALITY ARE GREATLY REDUCED.2.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:CREWS WILL CONTINUE OVER A FIVE-YEAR PERIOD TO PERFORM WORK IN FIRE PREVENTION TECHNIQUES, FUELS MANAGEMENT, RESOURCE PROTECTION, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, SAFETY, AND EQUIPMENT OPERATION. TYPES OF WORK TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: PRUNE AND CHIP TREE LIMBS UP TO 10 FEET FROM GROUND SURFACE, CUT DOWN AND CHIP TREES LESS THAN 4 INCHES DIAMETER AT BREAST HEIGHT (DBH), CUT AND REMOVE OR CHIP BRUSH AND SHRUB VEGETATION, MOW OR WEED NON-WOODY VEGETATION, REMOVE AND DISPOSE. CALIFORNIA CONSERVATION CORPS CREWS WILL TREAT BETWEEN 24-28 ACRES.3.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:VEGETATION WILL BE REMOVED BY HAND, USING HAND SAWS, POLE SAWS, AND CHAINSAWS. CUT MATERIALS WILL BE HAULED, STACKED IN PILES, AND CHIPPED WITH A MECHANICAL CHIPPER. CHIPPED MATERIALS WILL BE SCATTERED WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA AND LEFT ON SITE FOR NATURAL DECOMPOSITION AND SOIL STABILITY ENHANCEMENT. ALTHOUGH THE PRESCRIPTION ALLOWS FOR PILE BURNING THIS PROJECT HAS BEEN PLANNED WITH THE CHIPPING COMPONENT TO 1) AVOID SMOKE ISSUES, 2) CREATE A MORE COMPLETE PROJECT BY CUTTING AND CHIPPING, AND 3) AVOID ADDITIONAL CREW TIME FOR PILE BURNING. BURNING MAY BE USED IN SOME CASES TO ELIMINATE INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES INSTEAD OF CHIPPING WHERE THE BROADCAST OF MATERIAL MAY EXPAND SUCH SPECIES. PROJECTS WILL BE PERFORMED BY CALIFORNIA CONSERVATION CREWS AND CREW LEADERS ON RECLAMATION LANDS ACCORDING TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS MCA AND THE PROJECT TASK AGREEMENT INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING:4.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFIT OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FOR RECLAMATION'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE FIRE PROTECTION TO THE COMMUNITIES LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE URBAN INTERFACE WITH THE WILDERNESS.BY REDUCING THE WILDFIRE INTENSITY FACTOR, THE POTENTIAL FOR ECOSYSTEM/HABITAT DESTRUCTION AND IMPACTS TO WATER QUALITY ARE GREATLY REDUCED.5.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

AWARD PURPOSE:THE RECIPIENT, IN COOPERATION WITH THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION, WILL INCLUDE A CULTURAL RESOURCE TEAM MEMBER TO ASSIST WITH THE SURVEY AND RECORDATION OF HISTORIC RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ROZA DIVISION OF THE YAKIMA PROJECT. THE PROJECT IS LOCATED WITHIN THE COLUMBIA-CASCADES AREA OFFICE (CCAO) OF THE COLUMBIA-PACIFIC NORTHWEST REGION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FIRST COMPONENT OF THE PROJECT WILL BE THE SURVEY AND RECORDATION OF THE 11 MILES OF THE ROZA DIVISION MAIN CANAL MANAGED BY RECLAMATION (THE RECLAMATION REACH) AND PREPARATION OF A NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES (NRHP) NOMINATION FORM FOR THE ROZA DIVISION MAIN CANAL. THE INTERN WILL ALSO UPDATE THE HISTORIC PROPERTY INVENTORY (HPI) FORM FOR THE MAIN CANAL IN WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION'S (DAHP'S) WISAARD DATABASE. THE RESULTS OF RESEARCH AND NOMINATION WILL BE PRESENTED BY THE INTERN AT A PUBLIC TALK (DIGITAL OR IN-PERSON, BASED ON CURRENT RECLAMATION GUIDANCE). THE SECOND COMPONENT WILL BE THE SURVEY OF SIX BUILDINGS AT THE ROZA IRRIGATION DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS COMPLEX (WHICH ARE LOCATED ON RECLAMATION-OWNED LAND) AND THE PREPARATION OF HPI FORMS FOR THOSE BUILDINGS. THE INTERN WILL ALSO COMPLETE ADDITIONAL DUTIES AS REQUIRED WITHIN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES PROGRAM.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE CLEARLY DEFINED GOALS AND OFFER THE OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP KEY PROFESSIONAL SKILLS SUCH AS SCHEDULING AND TIME MANAGEMENT, FIELDWORK, INDEPENDENT RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL WRITING, AND TO PRESENT FINDINGS TO KEY DECISION MAKERS AND STAKEHOLDERS. THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT STARTING MAY 1, 2022, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF DECEMBER 31, 2022.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECT MEETS THE FOLLOWING PUBLIC PURPOSE OF THE ACT [16 U.S.C. -1721(B)]:(3) EXPOSE YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN TO PUBLIC SERVICE WHILE FURTHERING THEIR UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THE NATION'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES; (4) EXPAND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES BY REWARDING INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATE IN NATIONAL SERVICE WITH AN INCREASED ABILITY TO PURSUE HIGHER EDUCATION OR JOB TRAINING; AND (5) STIMULATE INTEREST AMONG THE NATION'S YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN IN CONSERVATION CAREERS BY EXPOSING THEM TO CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALS IN LAND MANAGING AGENCIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

THE PURPOSE OF THE AGREEMENT IS TO WORK WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY IN THE SELECTION AND PLACEMENT OF ONE YOUTH INTERN AT QUARTZ MOUNTAIN NATURE CENTER, LOCATED IN QUARTZ MOUNTAIN STATE PARK AT W C  AUSTIN, AND ONE YOUTH INTERN AT DISCOVERY COVE NATURE CENTER AT LAKE THUNDERBIRD STATE PARK AT NORMAN INTERNS WILL WELCOME VISITORS  ASSIST WITH FEEDING AND MAINTENANCE OF LIVE FISH AND WILDLIFEE  ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT AND PRESENTATION OF PARK PROGRAMS, NATIVE FISH AND WILDLIFE, CULTURAL HISTORY, AND OTHER RELATED TOPICS  ASSIST IN THE COLLECTION OF WILDLIFE SPECIMINS  AND DEVELOP MATERIALS FOR FISH AND WILDLIFE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS  OTHER DUTIES MAY INCLUDE MAINTAINING THE NATURE CENTER, GENERAL TRAIL MAINTENANCE, YOUTH GROUP WILDLIFE TOURS, YOUTH GROUP FISHING TRIPS, WILDLIFE HABITAT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS, AND OTHER RELATED TASKS INTERNS WILL GAIN SKILLS IN THE FIELD AND BUILD AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND GAIN EXPERIENCE TO BE USED IN FUTURE YEARS MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF RESOURCES

RECLAMATION IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH SO THEY CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION'S ROLE IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES. ADDITIONALLY, RECLAMATION WANTS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO BE INVOLVED IN CONSERVING RECLAMATION'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES SUCH AS THESE PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THESE YOUTH TO DEVELOP PROFESSIONAL AND LIFE SKILLS AS WELL AS AN INCREASED AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ETHICS AND STEWARDSHIP.THE INFORMATION GATHERED FOR THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY DETERMINING MANAGEMENT PLANNING FOR THE AREA AT LARGE FOR RECREATIONAL USE FOR THE PUBLIC.THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT SHALL COLLABORATE TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE PROJECTS DESCRIBED BELOW WHICH WILL PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND WORK OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH. RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT WILL COST SHARE THE RECRUITMENT AND PLACEMENT OF TWO (2) QUALIFIED YOUTH INTERNS FOR THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION'S DURANGO FIELD OFFICE, AND (1) QUALIFIED YOUTH INTERN FOR THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION'S GRAND JUNCTION FIELD OFFICE. THE YOUTH INTERNS SHALL BE UNDER THE OVERSIGHT OF RECLAMATION.PROJECT DESCRIPTION RECIPIENT, IN COOPERATION WITH RECLAMATION, SHALL RECRUIT THREE (3) QUALIFIED PEOPLE, 18 YEARS OR OLDER, THAT HAVE COMPLETED AT LEAST ONE YEAR AT AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION. THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES NECESSARY FOR THESE POSITIONS INCLUDE:KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, NATURAL AND CULTURAL HISTORY, NATIVE FISH AND WILDLIFE, AND GENERAL OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE ABILITY TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHERS TO EXPRESS IDEAS CLEARLY AND CONCISELY, BOTH ORALLY AND IN WRITING; TO EXERCISE INITIATIVE AND WORK INDEPENDENTLY; AND TO TAKE DIRECTION AND INSTRUCTION KNOWLEDGE OF CONSERVATION EDUCATION PRACTICES/ ACTIVITIES AND ASSOCIATED CURRICULUMS (I.E. PROJECT WET, PROJECT WILD, PROJECT LEARNING TREE)ABILITIES THAT ARE HIGHLY DESIRABLE, BUT NOT REQUIRED, FOR THE INTERN POSITIONS THAT WILL COLLECT DATA INCLUDE GIS/GPS KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROMOTE AND STIMULATE EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. THE GOAL IS TO TRAIN LEADERS FOR AMERICA'S FUTURE.THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, RECLAMATION AND RECIPIENT WILL COST-SHARE IN THE RECRUITMENT AND PLACEMENT OF YOUTH INTERNS AT RECLAMATION FACILITIES AND OFFICES SO THEY CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION'S ROLE IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES.THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A COMPONENT OF THE PHOENIX AREA OFFICE'S HASSAYAMPA RIVER STUDY - ASSESSING LOW IMPACT DEVELOPMENT FOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT (STUDY). THE STUDY INVESTIGATES THE USE OF GREEN STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE (GSI) TO MANAGE DEVELOPMENTAL AND REGIONAL STORMWATER ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE WHITE TANK MOUNTAINS IN THE CITY OF BUCKEYE LOCATED IN CENTRAL ARIZONA.FOR THIS PROJECT, THE YOUTH INTERN WILL:COMPLETE A COST ESTIMATE AND COST-BENEFIT ANALYSIS FOR GSI USED IN THE STUDY BASED ON MONETARY AND NON-MONETARY METRICS AND A FOCUS ON THAT WHICH IS MONETIZED.THE YOUTH INTERN WILL WORK WITH THE STUDY TEAM TO DEVELOP THE COST ANALYSIS PROCESS AND WILL REPORT AND DISCUSS TASK STATUS DURING MONTHLY STUDY MEETINGS.THE YOUTH INTERN WILL INTERACT WITH RECLAMATION PHOENIX AREA OFFICE AND DENVER TECHNICAL SERVICES CENTER STAFF TO COMPILE COST ANALYSIS INFORMATION, FCDMC STAFF TO REQUEST SV ADMP COST INFORMATION FOR GRAY INFRASTRUCTURE, AND CITY OF BUCKEYE STAFF FOR PERMIT AND UTILITY INFORMATION.WHEN THE TASK IS COMPLETE, THE YOUTH INTERN WILL PROVIDE A PRESENTATION TO THE STUDY TEAM.

THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT RECLAMATION AND THE RECPIENT WILL COLLABORATE TO RECRUIT AND PLACE YOUTH INTERNS AT RECLAMATION FACILITES AND OFFICES WHERE THE INTERN CAN GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECLAMATION'S ROLES IN CONSERVING WATER AND POWER RESOURCES.
